dct_description_sm: This polygon data layer represents environmental corridors for Waukesha County, Wisconsin in 1995. The dataset was originally published by the Southeast Wisconsin Regional Planning Commission (SEWRPC) in 2002.[This data set contains polygon features of existing environmental corridors and isolated natural resource areas for the seven county Southeastern Wisconsin region. The polygon features were delineated on land use inventory maps, with reference to 1""=400' scale aerial photographs, and digitized from these source materials. The data set was collected at 5-year intervals, and is current for the years 1990 and 1995. The polygons consist of primary and secondary environmental corridor areas and isolated natural resource areas as defined by SEWRPC.]
dct_creator_sm: Southeast Wisconsin Regional Planning Commission-Land Use Division and GIS Division
schema_provider_s: American Geographical Society Library â€“ UWM Libraries
dct_rights_sm: Please see the UWM Libraries statement on Copyright and Digitial Collections. [There are no legal prerequisites for accessing this data set. Potential users should contact the Southeastern Wisconsin Regional Planning Commission GIS Division.][This data set was prepared from aerial photography and land use maps acquired at approximately 5-year intervals. The most recent inventory may not reflect current environmental corridor conditions. Site investigation may be necessary to determine current type and extent of environmental corridors.]

[This data set was created for use by the Southeastern Wisconsin Regional Planning Commission for regional planning purposes.
